00021 #ifndef __TBB_task_group_H
00022 #define __TBB_task_group_H
00023 
00024 #include "task.h"
00025 
00026 namespace tbb {
00027 
00028 template<typename Function>
00029 class task_handle {
00030     Function my_func;
00031 
00032 public:
00033     task_handle( const Function& f ) : my_func(f) {}
00034 
00035     void operator()() { my_func(); }
00036 };
00037 
00038 namespace internal {
00039 
00040 // Suppress gratuitous warnings from icc 11.0 when lambda expressions are used in instances of function_task.
00041 //#pragma warning(disable: 588)
00042 
00043 template<typename Function>
00044 class function_task : public task {
00045     Function my_func;
00046     /*override*/ task* execute() {
00047         my_func();
00048         return NULL;
00049     }
00050 public:
00051     function_task( const Function& f ) : my_func(f) {}
00052 };
00053 
00054 template<typename Function>
00055 class task_handle_task : public task {
00056     task_handle<Function>& my_handle;
00057     /*override*/ task* execute() {
00058         my_handle();
00059         return NULL;
00060     }
00061 public:
00062     task_handle_task( task_handle<Function>& h ) : my_handle(h) {}
00063 };
00064 
00065 } // namespace internal
00066 
00067 
00068 enum task_group_status {
00069     not_complete,
00070     complete,
00071     canceled
00072 };
00073 
00074 class task_group: internal::no_copy {
00075     empty_task* my_root;
00076     task_group_context my_context;
00077 
00078 public:
00079     task_group()
00080         : my_context(task_group_context::bound, 
00081                      task_group_context::default_traits | task_group_context::concurrent_wait)
00082     {
00083         my_root = new( task::allocate_root(my_context) ) empty_task;
00084         my_root->set_ref_count(1);
00085     }
00086 
00087     ~task_group() try {
00088         __TBB_ASSERT( my_root->ref_count() != 0, NULL );
00089         if( my_root->ref_count() > 1 )
00090             my_root->wait_for_all();
00091         task::self().destroy(*my_root);
00092     }
00093     catch (...) {
00094         task::self().destroy(*my_root);
00095         throw;
00096     }
00097 
00098     template<typename Function>
00099     void run( const Function& f ) {
00100         task &s = task::self();
00101         s.spawn( *new( s.allocate_additional_child_of(*my_root) ) internal::function_task<Function>(f) );
00102     }
00103 
00104     template<typename Function>
00105     void run( task_handle<Function>& h ) {
00106         task &s = task::self();
00107         s.spawn( *new( s.allocate_additional_child_of(*my_root) ) internal::task_handle_task<Function>(h) );
00108     }
00109 
00110     template<typename Function>
00111     void run( const task_handle<Function>& ) {
00112         __TBB_ASSERT( false, "task_handle object must be non-const. A temporary as the argument?" );
00113     }
00114 
00115     template<typename Function>
00116     void run_local( Function& f ) {
00117         try {
00118             f();
00119         } catch ( ... ) {
00120             my_context.register_pending_exception();
00121         }
00122     }
00123 
00124     task_group_status wait() {
00125         try {
00126             task::self().prefix().owner->wait_for_all( *my_root, NULL );
00127         } catch ( ... ) {
00128             my_context.reset();
00129             throw;
00130         }
00131         if ( my_context.is_group_execution_cancelled() ) {
00132             my_context.reset();
00133             return canceled;
00134         }
00135         return complete;
00136     }
00137 
00138     bool is_canceling() {
00139         return my_context.is_group_execution_cancelled();
00140     }
00141 
00142     void cancel() {
00143         my_context.cancel_group_execution();
00144     }
00145 };
00146 
00147 typedef task_group structured_task_group;
00148 
00149 inline 
00150 bool is_current_task_group_canceling() {
00151     return task::self().is_cancelled();
00152 }
00153 
00154 } // namespace tbb
00155 
00156 #endif /* __TBB_task_group_H */
